009package imagingbook.common.ransac;
010
011import java.util.Arrays;
012//import java.util.HashSet;
013import java.util.Random;
014
015/**
016 * An instance of this class randomly draws a set of k unique, non-null elements
017 * from a given array of element type T, which may contain null elements (see
018 * method {@link #drawFrom(Object[], int)}). The size of the draw (k) is fixed
019 * and must be specified at construction. The resulting sets contain no
020 * duplicate elements.
021 * 
022 * @author WB
023 * @version 2022/11/19
024 *
025 * @param <T> element type
026 */
027public class RandomDraw<T> {
028        
029        /**
030         * Default maximum number of tries before exception is thrown.
031         */
032        public static final int DefaultMaxTries = 1000;
033        
034        private int maxTries = DefaultMaxTries;
035        private final Random rand;
036        
037        // -------------------------------------------------------------
038        
039        /**
040         * Constructor accepting an existing random generator.
041         * This may be useful to achieve predictable (repetitive) random behavior.
042         * 
043         * @param rand a random generator of type {@link Random}
044         */
045        public RandomDraw(Random rand) {
046                this.rand = (rand == null) ? new Random() : rand;
047        }
048        
049        /**
050         * Constructor creating its own random generator.
051         */
052        public RandomDraw() {
053                this(new Random());
054        }
055        
056        /**
057         * Set the maximum number of tries.
058         * @param maxTries new maximum number of tries
059         * @see #DefaultMaxTries
060         */
061        public void setMaxTries(int maxTries) {
062                this.maxTries = maxTries;
063        }
064        
065        // -------------------------------------------------------------
066        
067        // alternative version using a HashSet (slower)
068//      public T[] drawFrom(T[] items, int k) {
069//              if (k < 1) throw new IllegalArgumentException("k must be greater or equal 1");
070//              HashSet<T> hs = new HashSet<>(k);
071//              int i = 0;
072//              while (i < k) {
073//                      int j = rand.nextInt(items.length);     // next random index
074//                      T item = items[j];
075//                      if (item != null && hs.add(item)) {
076//                              i++;
077//                      }
078//              }
079//              return hs.toArray(Arrays.copyOf(items, k));
080//      }
081        
082        /**
083         * Randomly draws a set of k unique, non-null elements from the specified array
084         * of items, ignoring possible null elements. An exception is thrown if the
085         * maximum number of tries is exceeded (see {@link #DefaultMaxTries}). 
086         * The returned array contains no null elements and no duplicates.
087         * Example:
088         * <pre>
089         * Integer[] numbers = { null, 1, 2, null, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, null, null, null, 8, 9, 10, null };
090         * RandomDraw&lt;Integer&gt; rd = new RandomDraw&lt;&gt;();
091         * Integer[] draw = rd.drawFrom(numbers, 2);
092         * </pre>
093         * 
094         * @param items an array of elements of type T, null elements being allowed
095         * @param k     the number of items to draw
096         * @return an array of k randomly drawn (non-null) items
097         */
098        public T[] drawFrom(T[] items, int k) {
099                if (k < 1) throw new IllegalArgumentException("k must be greater or equal 1");
100                int[] idx = drawRandomIndexes(items, k);
101                T[] draw = Arrays.copyOf(items, k);     // trick to create an array of generic type T
102                for (int i = 0; i < k; i++) {
103                        draw[i] = items[idx[i]];
104                }
105                return draw;
106        }
107        
108        // draw k unique integers (all must be different):
109        private int[] drawRandomIndexes(T[] items, int k) {
110                int[] indexes = new int[k];
111                for (int d = 0; d < k; d++) {
112                        int j = 0;                                                      // count tries
113                        int i = rand.nextInt(items.length);
114                        while (items[i] == null || wasPickedBefore(indexes, d, i)) {
115                                i = rand.nextInt(items.length);
116                                if (j++ > maxTries) {
117                                        throw new RuntimeException("max. tries exceeded: " + j);
118                                }
119                        }
120                        indexes[d] = i;
121                }
122                return indexes;
123        }
124
125        // Checks if idx[0],...,idx[d-1] contains i.
126        private boolean wasPickedBefore(int[] indexes, int d, int i) {
127                for (int j = 0; j < d; j++) {
128                        if (i == indexes[j]) {
129                                return true;
130                        }
131                }       
132                return false;
133        }
134        
135}
